brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate choroidal thickness and volume during the third
      trimester of pregnancy by comparison with a group of age-matched non-pregnant healthy group
      of women

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Choroidal Thickness During Pregnancy Using Enhanced Depth Imaging Optical Coherence Tomography

detailed_description.textblock:
Pregnant women in the last trimester and age-matched healthy controls have an Optical
      Coherence Tomography (OCT) image taken on the OCT Spectralis® device.

      A map of the choroid in the macular area is constructed automatically. Choroidal thickness
      and volume are calculated for the 9 subfields defined by the Early Treatment Diabetic
      Retinopathy Study (ETDRS).

      A comparative analysis between the two groups will be performed. As a secondary outcome
      measure, the change in choroidal thickness of the pregnant group of women will be assessed
      at 6 months postpartum by comparison to the 3rd trimester of pregnancy.

      The OCT is a non-invasive examination that poses no risk to the mother or the fetus.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Pregnant women:

          -  uncomplicated pregnancy in the third trimester (from 28 weeks of gestation)

        For both groups:

          -  no systemic or ocular disease

          -  absence of systemic medication other than prenatal vitamins

          -  no smoking habits

          -  emmetropia or a small refractive error (spherical equivalent <1.5 diopters)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  any of the above

study_pop.textblock: Healthy pregnant women in the third trimester of pregnancy

intervention.description: Optical coherence tomography in enhanced depth imaging mode

primary_outcome.description: Comparison of choroidal thickness between the pregnant group of women and the age-matched group of control subjects
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3rd trimester of pregnancy (from 28 weeks gestation to delivery)

secondary_outcome.description: Change in choroidal thickness in the third trimester of pregnancy and at 6 months post partum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 3rd trimester (from 28 weeks gestation to delivery) and at 6 months post partum

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
